cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 mi (670 km) ESE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to bend northwest and pass north of the Leeward Islands and Puerto Rico toward the open Atlantic east of the Bahamas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall forecast in the next 5 days – center remains over open Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-storm watches extend across the northern Leeward Islands including Antigua, Barbuda, Anguilla, Sint Maarten, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy, Montserrat, St. Kitts, Nevis, Saba, St. Eustatius, British Virgin Islands, St. Thomas and St. John
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings for St. Martin, St. Barthelemy, Sint Maarten and Antigua–Barbuda–Anguilla
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, British Virgin Islands and waters north of Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Outer-band gusts could reach tropical-storm strength (up to 40 mph) Saturday night through Sunday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected – core remains well north of Puerto Rico
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1–3 inches of rain to northern and eastern Puerto Rico late Saturday through Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher surf along north-facing beaches beginning Saturday
